item.title: Space Marine.
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
OldDirtyBastard:

When I would build my reaver (I hope) I would do it like this:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C4GiDpjlBFQ

He’s never built anything that big, I think mostly because he doesn’t want to put the money down for the kit, considering he hasn’t played in years. He also doesn’t go that in-depth with disasembly. When he changes the pose of a mini, he usually just cuts the arm at the elbow or wrist, rotates it, and glues it back together. (possibly uses a pin)

Read full topic

item.title: Space Marine.
item.dc:creator: Luciel
item.description:
OldDirtyBastard:

You really do have to get an airbrush/spray gun for a LR or Rhino though.

Good thing Citadel has made a decent(and quite cheap) one.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J5IG6F301Js

I own a couple of different sizes which I use for pc modding, I´d definately use them to do a base coat on something big like that

Read full topic

item.title: Space Marine.
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
a spray can for the base coat

Well that’s basically what I was talking about. You don’t get a flat and even basing without a spray. Small details go by hand, of course.

change poses

When I would build my reaver (I hope) I would do it like this:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C4GiDpjlBFQ

Read full topic

item.title: Space Marine.
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
OldDirtyBastard:

You really do have to get an airbrush/spray gun for a LR or Rhino though.

My brother used to paint Warhammer minis all the time, and he still paints some now, he never uses a spray gun or airbrush. He uses a spray can for the base coat, the rest he always does by hand. Not the fastest way, but his stuff always looks impressive. I’ll see if I can get some pictures of some of his finished work if anyone is interested.

(he rarely does battle damage, but he does change poses quite often)

Read full topic

item.title: Space Marine.
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
They just have to shove them down your throats as the poster chapter, over and over again. That’s why they are popular.
Also, are you talking about this:

Because I didn’t have any instructions with it.

P.S. or this (not the one I was talking about)?

P.P.S. My favourites are space wolves. And Red Scorpions get an honourable mention as far as sick paint schemes go:

Read full topic

item.title: Space Marine.
item.dc:creator: Luciel
item.description:
Yeah was talking about the starter kit with paints, although not sure how it is now a days, around 8 years ago when I bought mine the instructions that came with such starter kit showed you step by step how to paint those 5 units as ultramarines.

Later on I repainted them to match the rest of my salamanders army. But yeah, I´d understand why people would stick to ultramarines, it´s a bit of an “I´ve got 5 painted, might as well stick to them” attitude I guess no?

Read full topic

item.title: Space Marine.
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
the starter kit comes with ultramarines

lololol no

Paint is bought separately.
P.S. If you’re talking about the kit with paints, glues, brush and clippers - GW guys can swap some cans for what you need. That’s what I did for my grey knights.

Dreadnought < Titans by far

Well duh.

1297×1600 208 KB

650×581 34.6 KB

item.title: Space Marine.
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
BahamutBBob:

So with Warcraft, Blizzard was making a Warhammer RTS, until Games Workshop pulled the rights.

With Starcraft, Blizzard was making a Warhammer 40k RTS, until Games Workshop pulled the rights.

Actually starcraft was never intended to be a 40k rts, it was inspired off of it heavily. Warcraft was the only one that was supposed to be a Warhammer game.

Read full topic

item.title: Space Marine.
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
P0lop1e:

Why do they have to make another thing with Ultra-Smurfs?
They could at least pick one of the ‘nobler’ chapters, i.e Blood Angels or the Black Templars.
The Ultra-Smurfs are just used too often for the table top game, using the Blood Raven for the Dawn of War games was one of the best thing they did. Then they had to screw it up with a shit film about a small team of Ultra-Smurf rookies, who arrive on a planet with hundreds of dead Imperial Fist (now what the hell they are doing outside of Terra or our solar system is still to be justified). But now making a multi-platform game about them… is quite risky.
I just hope the game is as good as boasted, cause otherwise it will be a real let down on the GW. (knowing how the UM are already pretty annoying)

Give a fuck? Why bitch and moan about this shit on black mesa forums?
Fuck off. Go whine some more on w40k fluff forums.

And no, Ultramarines are perfectly ok there.

Read full topic

item.title: Space Marine.
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
Meh, the Imperator Titans are bigger.

Cool story bro. I still don’t give a shit.

Finished it. Ending was pretty fucking good.
SP was surprisingly not boring. Maybe splat splat splat was the reason.

It still needs more combos, more weapons - and terminator armour levels.

https://designislaw.tumblr.com/post/1…st-suprisingly

it’s 40th millenium, what the fuck is this guy surprised about.

Read full topic
